page.title: 02Garvald Weather
page.content: In East Lothian, Garvald is reputed to be a remote village frequently cut off by winter snows. Infact it lies so near the east end of the Lammermuirs that the total precipitation is under 20" and drought is as common a problem as too much rain or snow. Much of the year the weather is sunny but the valley in which the village lies faces south west and the prevailing west wind tends to hurtle down. However the easterlies are colder and bring the dreaded haar, usually for three days at a stretch and make the chimneys smoke. The village is in a frost pocket and can be white whilst the surrounding fields are green and sunny. l985 has been very exceptionally wet and sunless.
